In a new tweet on his official X account, Nikki Sixx revealed a sad update on MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼eâ€™s tour schedule.
â€œHow are you doing?â€ a fan asked the bassist in a Q&A session. Sixx replied, â€œThank you for asking. Me and Courtney [Sixx] are really busy between all our businessâ€™s and our daughter. Nice to be off the road til next year.â€
MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼e announced in September that they would perform shows at The Roxy, Troubadour, and Whisky A Go Go in Los Angeles. The band had three exclusive, intimate club shows at Hollywoodâ€™s Sunset Strip on October 7, October 9, and October 11.
The three club shows happened after the release of MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼eâ€™s â€˜Cancelledâ€™ EP on October 4. The EP, their first with Big Machine, has three new songs: â€˜Dogs Of War,â€™ â€˜Fight For Your Right,â€™ a cover of the Beastie Boysâ€™ song, and the title track â€˜Cancelled.â€™

They shared a video on social media of a trash truck pulling up to the venue and unloading trash, only for the band members to jump out.
They captioned the clip, â€œMÃ¶tley CrÃ¼e gets dumped back out in a trash truck on the Sunset Strip in Hollywood for night 1 of the HÃ–LLYWOOD TAKEÃ–VER!â€
MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼e also reminded fans about a charity auction with instruments used on stage, each signed by the band. The money raised went to Covenant House International.
Though the Hollywood Takeover was meant to go back to basics, MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼e still played their usual hit songs at the Troubadour. The 16-song set included classics like â€˜Primal Scream,â€™ â€˜Shout at the Devil,â€™ and â€˜Kickstart My Heart,â€™ along with newer songs like â€˜Dogs of Warâ€™ and a cover of the Beastie Boysâ€™ â€˜Fight For Your Right.â€™
MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼eâ€™s deal with Big Machine brings them back together after working on the 2014 album â€˜Nashville Outlaws: A Tribute To MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼e.â€™ Big Machine also worked with MÃ¶tley CrÃ¼eâ€™s new guitarist John 5 on his 2021 album â€˜Sinner.â€™ CrÃ¼eâ€™s last studio album was â€˜Saints Of Los Angelesâ€™ in 2008.
